com.model

Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.model.GameLogic

  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    The main game class. Here the main methods of almost all other functions are called.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameLogic(PrairieKing game, boolean forTest)
      /** Creates a new Game, and stores the Prairie King instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Updates every game entity, frame by frame.
      void checkLose(EntityController model)
      Checks whether the hero has been killed.
      AIManager getAI()
      Returns the AI to have acess to all the enemies.
      GameStage getGameStage()
      Returns the active GameStage, important for render in Prairie King.
      Gun getGun()
      Returns active Gun, important to GameStage because the Gun class stores all the location of the active projectiles.
      HeroController getHero()
      Returns the HeroModel, so the both GameStage and every Enemy knows exactly where the hero is at the moment their methods are invoked.
      HeroBody getHeroBody()
      Important for animation.
      PowerupSpawner getPowerupSpawner()
      Returns PowerupSpawner, important for GameStage to know if and where are powerups located.
      PrairieKing getPrairieKing()
      Returns the Prairie King instance.
      com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World getWorld()
      Necessary to add new Bodies to the world.
      boolean isForTest() 
      void resetEverything()
      When the player is either killed, or wins and wants to start a new game, this resets everything to its default values.
      void win()
      Is called when the player wins.

    • Method Detail

      • resetEverything

        public void resetEverything()
        When the player is either killed, or wins and wants to start a new game, this resets everything to its default values. This way, only one instance of gameLogic is necessary.

      • act

        public void act()
        Updates every game entity, frame by frame.

      • checkLose

        public void checkLose(EntityController model)
        Checks whether the hero has been killed. If so, lose.
        Parameters:
        model - Possibly HeroModel.

      • win

        public void win()
        Is called when the player wins.
